title: Basic Auth
user_story:
As the service provider\
I want to have the option to individually restrict access for specific environments\
So I can access control a testing environment independently from production or demo
description:
* for an admin it should be possible to restrict environment access via basic auth
* an admin should be able to configure each environment independently 
  * activate/deactivate basic auth
  * define a set of basic auth credentials
* for each environment only one set of basic auth credentials is required (not every user or user group needs one)
  * whoever has the credentials can enter the environment (but not necessarily access the API â†’ see MCA-645)
* when basic auth is activated 
  * when the API user provides valid credentials 
    * then access is granted and the request is processed
    * the (positive) authentication status has no impact on the HTTP status code
  * when the API user provides invalid credentials (or none at all)
    * then access is denied and the request is not processed
    * status code is \`401\`
* this mechanic should work for a local environment, in minikube and in gke
